author: craigmcc
msg: Clarify the circumstances under which the "input" attribute of an <action>
element is required.

author: craigmcc
msg: Rearrange the processing in processValidate() as follows:
* If there is a form bean, and the request is not cancelled, call the
form bean's validate() method.  Previously, validate() was only called
if the mapping included an "input" property, which could lead to errors
if the developer forgot to include the "input" definition.
* If the validate() method returns one or more errors, and there is no
"input" form to return control to, throw an error 500.  The reasoning is
that the application has been mis-configured ("input" attribute missing).
Submitted by:  Pierre Metras <genepi@sympatico.ca>

author: mschachter
msg: - Fixed poor performance of MultipartIterator, and in turn overall
performance of file uploading
- Fixed goofy bug in getFileElements and getTextElements in
DiskMultipartRequestHandler, as well as allowing for use of the modified
MlutipartIterator class

author: craigmcc
msg: Add a commented-out example of what configuring the new data source
would look like if the same application used a database.

author: craigmcc
msg: Initial implementation of a simple JDBC data source for Struts based
applications.  The data source implements the javax.sql.DataSource
interface, and may be configured by new extensions to the
struts-config.xml DTD.  More sophisticated data source implementations may
also be used, as long as they implement javax.sql.DataSource.
